submission:
class Solution:
    def minimumCost(self, m: int, n: int, horizontalCut: List[int], verticalCut: List[int]) -> int:
        horizontalCut.sort(reverse=True)
        verticalCut.sort(reverse=True)
        hi, vi = 0, 0
        hPiece, vPiece = 1, 1
        cost = 0
        while hi < len(horizontalCut) and vi < len(verticalCut):
            hCut, vCut = horizontalCut[hi], verticalCut[vi]
            if hCut > vCut:
                cost += hCut * vPiece
                hPiece += 1
                hi += 1
            else:
                cost += vCut * hPiece
                vPiece += 1
                vi += 1
        
        while hi < len(horizontalCut):
            cost += horizontalCut[hi] * vPiece
            hi += 1
        while vi < len(verticalCut):
            cost += verticalCut[vi] * hPiece
            vi += 1
        return cost
